oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Charging for remote consultation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pop, Alexandru Mihai
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Remote consultation in veterinary practice is an evolving ser足vice that allows veterinarians to provide professional advice, diagnosis and treatment recommendations without being physically present. Despite its increasing prevalence, many vet足erinary professionals struggle with structuring fees for these services and effectively communicating their value to clients, as well as believing their value within. This paper explores the economic worth of veterinary expertise, the necessity of struc足tured consultation fees, and strategies for client communica足tion to ensure professional sustainability while maintaining trust, satisfaction and prioritizing animal health.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 59 (2025): 2025 Recent Graduate Conference Proceedings; 110-111
